abstract: Deals normally evaporate in the middle of the summer as the temperature rises and bankers decamp for the beach. But the start of this week proved to be an exception to the rule and again revived the concept of a “Merger Monday.”
snippet: Deals normally evaporate in the middle of the summer as the temperature rises and bankers decamp for the beach. But the start of this week proved to be an exception to the rule and again revived the concept of a “Merger Monday.”
lead_paragraph: Deals normally evaporate in the middle of the summer as the temperature rises and bankers decamp for the beach.

headline.main: The Return of Merger Monday, July Edition

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
